definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: China has a vast territory with rich natural resources.
sentences.chinese: 中国地大物博，自然资源丰富。

sentences.english: As China's vast land, agricultural production unique.
sentences.chinese: 我国地大物博，农产品生产各具特色。

sentences.english: Chinese people are proud of than the "vast land."
sentences.chinese: 中国人最引以为豪的莫过于“地大物博”。

sentences.english: China is a vast land rich in tourism resources.
sentences.chinese: 中国地大物博，旅游资源丰富。

sentences.english: China's a big place with abundant resources, especially when it comes to civil servants.
sentences.chinese: 中国地大物博，尤盛产各类公仆。

sentences.english: China is a land of immense scale and diversity, an ancient civilization with a fascinating history dating back thousands of years.
sentences.chinese: 中国地大物博，古老的文明有着几千年迷人的历史。

definition: size (i.e. area) of a country, geographical region or school campus etc/(fig.) scope/extent
Celestial Empire, tributary title conferred on imperial China/Taiping Heavenly Kingdom
illustrious hero, spirit of the place (idiom); a place derives reflected glory from an illustrious son
lit. source is distant and the flow is long (idiom); fig. sth goes back to the dim and distant past/a lot of water has flowed under the bridge since then
common term for non-Han peoples in former times, not exclusively derogatory/barbarian
(lit.) land of fish and rice/(fig.) fertile region/land of milk and honey
